data.title: Pat Green Lyrics
data.meta_description: Pat Green song lyrics, artist web site link, Amazon CD links, and audio and video clips.
data.text:
"Way Back Texas" by Pat Green (Wendell Mobley/Craig Wiseman)

1st Verse

Sometimes it's a car

A certain shade of misty blue

I think of you

And I wonder how on earth you are

Or sometimes just a song

Is playin' on my radio

And there I go

Just a'wishin' you were singin' along

Pre Chorus

And that's all it takes

And I drift off to dreamin' I'm in

Chorus

Way Back, Texas

(You were) (Were you) layin' in my arms

Had a class ring necklace

We're gonna buy that little farm

Way down by the river

Yeah, (raise a family) (live a'happily)

Down in Way Back, Texas

(Uh, huh) (Way back)

Population: you and me

2nd Verse

Me, I'm doin' well

With no one in particular

But girl, I heard that you went

And you rang them weddin' bells

They say his name is John

His daddy owns a dealership

But the slipper don't quite fit

Yeah, but life goes on and on

Pre Chorus

So I guess that I'll hang up

I just wondered if you ever dream of

(Repeat Chorus)

Bridge

And every now and then

If you need me I'll be back in

(Repeat Chorus)

"Dixie Lullaby" by Pat Green (Pat Green/Patrick Davis/Justin Andrew Pollard)

1st Verse

My father had skin like leather

Hands like steel

From a lifetime spent in a cotton field

And though he'd come home tired and dirty

Almost every night

He found the strength to smile at me

And hold my mama tight

Pre Chorus

While that ol' transistor radio

Would play the Opry out in the hall

I'd sit and watch those shadows

Glide across the wall

1st Chorus

And they danced to a Dixie lullaby

A picture of love beneath a Southern sky

Oh my, what a beautiful life

Just like a Dixie lullaby

2nd Verse

I left home at eighteen

In a hand-me-down Chevrolet

Packed with my mama's cookin'

And my old man's stubborn ways

It was college, work, and love

And then the babies came

The youngest one got his grandaddy's name

Pre Chorus

And in the early mornin' hours

When my children could not sleep

I'd rock them in my arms to a gentle be at

2nd Chorus

And sing them a Dixie lullaby

Hush baby, don't you start to cry

Oh my, what a beautiful life

Just like a Dixie lullaby

3rd Verse

My father was a mountain of a man

That was the description that I gave

The mornin' that we laid him in his grave

There with my mama by his side

I said my last goodbye

To a man I thought would never die

Pre Chorus

And as I stood there in that field

Of amazing grace

Oh, how the tears ran down my face

Tag Chorus

And I sang him a Dixie lullaby

We'll meet again by and by

Oh my, what a beautiful life

Just like a Dixie lullaby

Oh my, what a beautiful life

Just like a Dixie lullaby

"Feels Just Like It Should" by Pat Green (Pat Green/Brett James/Justin Andrew Pollard)

1st Verse

Let's jump in my El Camino, uh uh huh

Roll the windows down

Thought we'd see

What kind 'a trouble we could find

Out on this messed up little town

Put the Boss on the radio, uh huh

Take whatever comes

We'll go flyin' down the highway

With my arm around you

Singin' 'Born to Run'

Chorus

(And) it feels just like it should

Must be some kind of miracle

Like I got sun on my face

And the rain it ain't never gonna fall

It feels so good

(Oh) (Man) it's almost spiritual

Tomorrow's nowhere in sight

Right now, right here tonight

It feels just like it should

2nd Verse

Well, you got your good looks, uh huh

And you got your style

And I drowned here in this ocean

Just to have you float my boat for a while

I've got a reputation, uh huh

But don't you worry 'bout that

Just give me a chance

And we're never gonna ever look back

(Repeat Chorus)

Bridge

Maybe Romeo gets the girl this time

I guess everybody gets a chance to shine

And tonight is mine

(Repeat Chorus)

"Baby Doll" by Pat Green (Pat Green/Rob Thomas)

1st Verse

She stops and checks her reflection

In a car parked on the corner

She said,

'It's hell on me, this workin' down at the diner'

Some people say,

'Man, she was hot back when she was younger'

Ya, well, she was a dancer when she lived in LA

Pre Chorus

She was someone's baby doll

A beauty queen to someone long ago

From the midnight show

Chorus

And (if) (when) you close your eyes

You hear the music playin'

You can see her dancin'

Underneath the spotlight, and

When she sleeps

She dreams she's back in Hollywood

Back when all the world was young

And she was someone's baby doll

2nd Verse

She stops and checks her reflection

In the bathroom on her lunch break

She says,

'I still look good for someone half of my real age'

Some people say,

'Man, I bet she still makes love like an earthquake'

Yeah, but man, she ain't easy

She ain't lettin' you in, my friend, my friend

Pre Chorus

It's time to wake up, baby doll

Put your best dress and your high heels on

And dream you're gone

(Repeat Chorus)

3rd Verse

She stops and calls an old friend

From the pay phone at the subway

She says,

'I feel like I'm just sittin' here

Wastin' my days away'

Pre Chorus

It's time to move on, baby doll

And walk away just like you did before

When you wanted more

Tag Chorus

And when you close your eyes

You hear the music playin'

You can see her dancin'

Underneath the spotlight, and

When she sleeps

She dreams she's back in Hollywood

When she was a younger girl

A pretty heart in a tainted world

Not sure who you wanna be

Your Daddy's little drama queen

I hope that when you find yourself

You're more than just a baby doll

"Guy Like Me" by Pat Green (Pat Green/David Neuhauser/Pat Green Band)

1st Verse

Hearts and flowers

Forget love letters

Pain and anger

Forget forgiveness

Love ain't waitin' (for) (on) a guy like me

2nd Verse

Debutants and champagne

Diamonds and cocaine

I ain't the son of

Outrageous fortune

Cash ain't status for a guy like me

Chorus

(So) Put me on a cool river

Take my (worries) (sins) (pain) from me

Fly me high on a big, blue sky

Where there's no one here (but) (just) me

((Ah) (Yeah) just me)

3rd Verse

Long black limosine

Pictures in magazines

All night parties

Beautiful people

No supermodel for a guy like me

4th Verse

I'm just a good man

I work with my hands

I get the picture

I heard the message

Hell ain't waitin' for a guy like me

(Repeat Chorus Twice)

(Repeat 1st Verse)

(Chorus Out)

"Wave On Wave" by Pat Green (Pat Green/David Neuhauser/Justin Pollard)

1st Verse

Mile upon mile, got no direction

We're all playin' the same game

We're all lookin' for redemption

Just afraid to say the name

So caught up now in pretending

What we're seekin' is the truth

I'm just lookin' for a happy ending

All I'm lookin' for is you

Chorus

(And) (Yeah) it came upon me wave on wave

You're the reason I'm still here, yeah

Am I the one you were sent to save

And it came upon me wave on wave

(Wave on wave, wave on wave)

2nd Verse

I wandered out into the water

And I thought that I might drown

I don't know what I was after

Just know I was goin' down

That's when she found me

Not afraid anymore

She said, 'You know, I always had you, baby

Just waitin' for you to find what you were lookin' for'

(Repeat Chorus Twice)

Tag Chorus

The clouds broke, and the angels cried

You ain't gonna walk alone

That's why they put me in your way

And it came upon me wave on wave

(Chorus Out)
